business.headline: NSDL IPO fully booked: Should you subscribe or skip Rs 4,000 crore listing?National Securities Depository Ltd (NSDL) aims to raise Rs 4,011.60 crore through a complete offer for sale (OFS) of 5.01 crore equity shares by existing shareholders.

NSDL IPO Day 1: Check latest subscription status, GMP and moreIn the grey market, NSDL's shares are commanding a premium of Rs 126, implying an estimated listing price of Rs 926—around 15.75 percent higher than the issue price.
TCS CEO's salary in focus amid mass layoff plan. Here's how much he earnsTCS recently confirmed it will let go of about 2% of its workforce in FY26, which translates to roughly 12,000 employees.

Infosys to hire 20,000 freshers in 2025, focus on AI: ReportInfosys CEO said that the IT firm has made early investments in AI and training its staff. So far, the company has trained about 2.75 lakh employees at different levels in AI and related areas.

ITR-3 online filing begins: Are you eligible and what's new?The Income Tax Department has kick-started online filing for ITR-3, bringing relief to taxpayers with more complex income sources. If you're wondering whether this applies to you and what's changed this year, here's everything in simple terms.

Talk money like you talk love: Investment advisor's advice for newlywedsAn investment advisor's advice to young couples goes beyond numbers. Abhishek Kumar emphasises that financial clarity is just as essential as emotional honesty when building a strong, lasting marriage.

GNG Electronics shares make bumper debut at 50% premium. Sell or hold?GNG Electronics shares listed at Rs 355 apiece on the NSE. This is nearly 50% higher than the IPO price of Rs 237 per share, giving early investors a sizeable gain on debut.

IMF lifts India's growth forecast for 2025 and 2026 to 6.4%India's steady growth projection comes as a bright spot in the global economic landscape, with the IMF stressing that policy continuity, labour reforms, and infrastructure investment will be crucial going forward.

Sensex and Nifty under pressure: What's behind Dalal Street's July slide?After months of strong gains, July brought a sobering pause to India's stock market rally. Expensive valuations, tepid earnings, and foreign outflows dragged indices down in a broad, sentiment-driven correction.
Sona Comstar sends cease-and-desist notice to Rani Kapur. What it meansSona Comstar has demanded that Rani Kapur withdraw her July 24 letter addressed to the board, shareholders, and stakeholders.

Explained: Why L&T share price jumped over 4% after Q1 resultsL&T reported a 30% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 3,617 crore for the April–June quarter, beating analyst estimates. Revenue from operations rose 16% YoY to Rs 63,679 crore.
Sensex opens 60 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; L&T up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 45.19 points to 81,383.14, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 12.55 points to 24,833.65 as of 9:32 am.

Apple is shutting a store in China for the first time. Here's whyFor the first time, Apple plans to shut a physical retail location in mainland China, a move that comes nearly two decades after it began operations there.

Earthquake and Trump tariff heat: Will stock markets open lower today?At 7:50 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,825 points, suggesting that the Nifty 50 will open near Tuesday's closing level of 24,821.1.

Is the India-US trade deal on track? Trump shares new updateDonald Trump had earlier announced higher tariffs in April but delayed them by introducing a reduced 10% levy to allow room for negotiations. With the August 1 deadline approaching, pressure is building on both countries to make progress.

US delegation set to visit India on August 25 for key trade discussionsIndia is asking the US to remove the proposed 26% extra tariff and reduce high duties on Indian steel and aluminium products, which currently face tariffs of up to 50%.

Wife pays no income tax after selling two houses gifted by husbandA woman from Mumbai won a court case at the Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT), which said she did not have to pay income tax after selling two flats worth Rs 6 crore.
Sensex ends 427 points higher; Nifty above 24,800; RIL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 446.93 points to close at 81,337.95, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 140.20 points to end at 24,821.10.

Selling your house? Here's how you can save lakhs in taxesSection 54 of the Income Tax Act allows exemption on long-term capital gains earned from the sale of a residential house or plot of land if the profit is reinvested in buying or constructing a new residential property in India.
HDFC, ICICI and 4 other banks offering high FD rates. Check nowICICI Bank also offers 6.6% interest, but on a longer tenure, between 2 and 10 years. For senior citizens, the rate is 7.10%.

Lenskart takes first step towards IPO, files draft with SebiAccording to the draft papers, the IPO will include a fresh issue of shares worth up to Rs 2,150 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of up to 13.23 crore shares by existing shareholders.

EU-sanctioned refiner Nayara turns to Rediff after Microsoft suspension: ReportThe shift comes in the wake of fresh European Union sanctions announced on July 18 that targeted Nayara for its links to Russia.

Russia-backed Indian Refiner Nayara trims crude runs in wake of EU sanctionsPrivately-held Nayara, which runs India's third-biggest refinery at the port of Vadinar in the western state of Gujarat, controls nearly 8% of the country's total refining capacity of about 5.2 million bpd.

Is tax filing deadline getting extended again? These key ITR utilities still pendingThis year, the ITR forms were notified only by the end of May, much later than usual. After that, the utilities were rolled out in phases, and key tools are still missing.

Will India clinch a US trade deal before August 1? Here's what we knowSpeaking last week, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said that there were "no sticking points" in the India-US relationship and added that issues like immigration and H-1B visas had not come up in the current trade talks.

Nasscom expects more layoffs as IT industry faces major transitionThis comes just days after Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), the country's largest IT employer, announced it would cut 2% of its global staff. Around 12,000 mid- and senior-level employees will be let go as the company adjusts its team structure.

TCS may pause hikes, senior hiring after mass layoffs announcement: ReportTCS shares have dropped nearly 30% over the past year, ranking among the weakest in the Nifty IT index. Shares of the company are down 25% on  year-to-date basis and have fallen nearly 12% in a month.

Explained: Why Mazagon Dock share price tumbled 5% after Q1 resultsThe Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders stock was down 4.50% to Rs 2,664.25 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 10:34 am. In a month, the stock has tumbled 18%, still up almost 19% this year.

Laxmi India Finance IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check detailsThe IPO includes a fresh issue of 1.05 crore shares worth Rs 165.17 crore and an offer for sale of 56 lakh shares worth Rs 89.09 crore.
Sensex opens 200 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; Infosys down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 62.31 points to 80,828.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 7.20 points to 24,673.70 as of 9:26 am.

Who is P&G's new Indian-born global CEO, Shailesh JejurikarShailesh Jejurikar's promotion was announced as part of a leadership change at P&G. The company's current CEO, Jon R. Moeller, will move into the role of executive chairman.

Aditya Infotech IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPThe bidding window will remain open till July 31, 2025. Aditya Infotech IPO consists of a fresh issue worth Rs 500 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of shares worth Rs 800 crore by promoter group entities.

Brigade Hotel Ventures IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusThose who applied for shares can check their allotment status either on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or through the portal of KFin Technologies Limited, the official registrar for this IPO.

Should you be paying rent with credit card?More and more people are using credit cards to pay rent. But does the benefit of extra days to pay and cashback outweigh the fees and credit score impact? Let's break it down.
Sensex ends 572 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; Kotak Bank down 7%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 572.07 points to end at 80,891.02, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 156.10 points to close at 24,680.90.

5 IPOs worth Rs 7,000 crore to open for bidding this week. Check detailsThis week, five mainboard IPOs are opening for bidding: NSDL (National Securities Depository), M&B Engineering, Sri Lotus Developers & Realty, Aditya Infotech, and Laxmi India Finance.

Can opting for old regime help you save tax in FY25?Many believe that under the new tax regime, there is no tax on income up to Rs 12 lakh. However, this change will only take effect from April 1, 2025, and will apply to returns filed for the FY26.

Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta slams Dior for ignoring Indian artisans behind $200K coatThe luxury brand Dior showcased a $200K coat adorned with traditional Lucknowi 'mukaish' embroidery. While 12 Indian artisans spent 34 days crafting it, their names, and India's contribution, went unacknowledged.

Is TCS cutting jobs because of AI? Here's what CEO K Krithivasan saysTCS CEO K Krithivasan said that the company is still looking for highly skilled professionals, especially those who can support TCS's plans to expand into new technologies and markets.

What homeowners need to know about house property tax rules, explains tax advisorBuying a home comes with more than just EMIs and maintenance; it brings tax implications too. Sujit Bangar, Founder of TaaxBuddy.com, breaks down the key rules every homeowner should be aware of to avoid surprises during filing season.

entertainment.headline: Farah Khan shares Salim Khan's early doubts about Salman's stardomFilmmaker Farah Khan shared that Salim Khan once doubted Salman Khan's Bollywood future, much like Saqib Saleem's father did. The filmmaker shared this during a chat with Huma Qureshi and Saqib about their struggles convincing their parents.

Find me in every lifetime: Sonam Kapoor's moving post on husband Anand's birthdaySonam Kapoor celebrated her husband Anand Ahuja's birthday with a heartfelt social media tribute, expressing deep affection and joy he brings to her life. Anil Kapoor also wished his son-in-law on the big day.

Who is Arjun Pratap Bajwa? All about Sara Ali Khan's companion for Gurudwara visitSara Ali Khan's recent Gurudwara visit with Arjun Pratap Bajwa in Delhi has reignited dating rumours, leaving fans curious. Arjun, an actor-musician with a political lineage, is steadily gaining attention in Bollywood circles.

Sara Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor trolled for ramp walk at India Couture WeekActors Sara Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor faced the wrath of social media users for their ramp walk at India Couture Week. The videos of their ramp walk went viral on social media.

BTS' Kim Taehyung hints at surprise for ARMY in AugustBTS member V hinted at a surprise for ARMYs this August during a recent Weverse live session. His emotional openness and cryptic posts have sparked widespread fan speculation ahead of BTS' 2025 reunion.

Rishab Shetty is a rebel with a cause in director Ashwin Gangaraju's film. Poster outActor-director Rishab Shetty has joined hands with Sithara Entertainments for a film directed by Ashwin Gangaraju. The film is set in 18th-century Bengal and promises to be a grand-scale action drama.

Param Sundari release postponed, makers announce new date for Sidharth-Janhvi's filmThe release date of the much-awaited film 'Param Sundari' has been postponed. Starring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor, the film will now release in cinemas after 'War 2'.

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi review: Tulsi, nostalgia and nothing moreThe first episode of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2' is a nostalgic trip down memory lane, bringing back iconic characters and moments without much new development. While Smriti Irani's return as Tulsi warms the heart, the show heavily relies on past glory and familiar storylines.

After Ramya, actor Pratham files complaint against Darshan's fans over threatsActor Pratham has approached Bangalore rural police alleging threats from fans of actor Darshan. This follows similar complaints by actor-politician Ramya against abusive social media accounts linked to Darshan's supporters.

Kyunki Saas...reboot X reviews: Fans get emotional, say show is nostalgia pro max'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot starring Smriti Irani and Amar Upadhyay aired on television on July 29. The new season not only brought back several memories of the show, but left many emotional.

Saiyaara box office Day 12: Ahaan-Aneet's love story eyes Rs 500 crore globallyMohit Suri's 'Saiyaara', featuring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has raked in an estimated Rs 266 crore in India within 12 days.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu Day 6: Pawan Kalyan film crashes, fails to mint Rs 2 crorePawan Kalyan's 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' has crashed at the box office. The period drama failed to mint even Rs 2 crore at the domestic box office.

Pamela Anderson, Liam Neeson dating? Couple address relationship rumoursActors Pamela Anderson and Liam Neeson walked the red carpet with their children, sparking rumours of a possible romance. The duo is set to appear together in the upcoming film, 'The Naked Gun'.

Sunjay Kapur's wife Priya Sachdev updates Instagram name amid succession disputeLate businessman Sunjay Kapur's wife, Priya Sachdev, changed her Instagram name following a Rs 30,000 crore dispute with her mother-in-law.

Suriya's Etharkkum Thunindhavan did poor numbers, I take responsibility: DirectorDirector Pandiraj, in a recent interview, admitted that his film with Suriya, 'Etharkkum Thunindhavan', failed at the box office. He also claimed that the films that came after 'Etharkkum Thunindhavan' for Suriya didn't surpass the collections of his film.

Can Kingdom end the long shadow of Arjun Reddy on Vijay Deverakonda's career?Vijay Deverakonda's meteoric rise post 'Arjun Reddy' was as explosive as it was divisive. With 'Kingdom', his upcoming collaboration with 'Jersey' director Gowtam Tinnanuri, all eyes are on whether this could finally be the film that helps him break free, reset the narrative, and reclaim his space as a performer.

Tom Cruise, 63, Ana de Armas, 37, soft-launch relationship? Internet can't keep calmTom Cruise and Ana de Armas were spotted in Vermont, fuelling speculation about a possible romantic involvement. Internet users have been sharing their thoughts on their union.

Slept on platform, played 65 at 28: How Anupam Kher knew he was different but no lessIn his book 'Different But No Less', Anupam Kher tells the story of an autistic girl defying odds in 'Tanvi: The Great', but also mirrors it with his own journey of resilience. From arriving in Mumbai with Rs 37 to challenging every stereotype thrown his way, Kher's book is a personal reflection on what it means to be seen as different.

Christopher Nolan faces backlash for filming The Odyssey in disputed Western SaharaChristopher Nolan is filming parts of The Odyssey in the disputed Western Sahara region. The decision has drawn criticism over the ongoing Moroccan occupation and repression of the Sahrawi people.

general news.headline: Pak-China tango because...: Jaishankar's 'China guru' jibe at Jairam RameshThe minister took a 'China guru' jibe at Jairam Ramesh for repeatedly making claims about China and Pakistan and highlighted how the country is today paying for the mistakes made during the Congress rule.

Live: Tsunami hits California, over 1-foot wave recorded after powerful Russia quakeOne of the world's strongest earthquakes since 2011 struck Russia's Far East early Wednesday, with a powerful 8.8-magnitude tremor jolting the Kamchatka Peninsula and triggering tsunami alerts across the northern Pacific. The quake, the strongest in the region since 1952, was followed by intense aftershocks, with seismologists warning of further tremors up to magnitude 7.5 in the coming weeks. A tsunami wave hit North Kurilsk, flooding parts of the settlement and a local fishing facility. Evacuations were reported across Kamchatka, the Kuril Islands, and parts of Japan, while tsunami sirens sounded as far as Alaska, Hawaii, and even New Zealand.

Monster 8.8 earthquake in Russia sparks Pacific tsunami alert: Japan, US on edgeA massive 8.8-magnitude undersea quake off Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula triggered tsunami waves of up to 4 metres, prompting evacuations and alerts across Japan and several Pacific nations.

Oval outrage: How much is too much from coach Gautam Gambhir?India vs England: Gautam Gambhir's public demeanour has been under intense scrutiny throughout the Test series against England. From taking a confrontational tone against journalists to a bust-up against the Oval groundstaff, how much is too much from Gambhir?

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi review: Tulsi, nostalgia and nothing moreThe first episode of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2' is a nostalgic trip down memory lane, bringing back iconic characters and moments without much new development. While Smriti Irani's return as Tulsi warms the heart, the show heavily relies on past glory and familiar storylines.

Don't be sad, death most beautiful: CA buys helium, dies by suicide in DelhiThe man, identified as Dheeraj Kansal, worked at a company in Gurugram and had sourced the gas from a supplier in Ghaziabad after searching for it on IndiaMART.
Dhankhar dhamaka: The inside story of what forced the vice-president outAmong the reasons: an impeachment motion against a judge, purported internal dissent and some power play

Woman, 30, leader of Al Qaeda terror module, arrested from BengaluruThe Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) arrested 30-year-old Shama Parveen from Bengaluru, who is accused of running an AQIS-linked terror module. Four others were earlier held in Gujarat, Noida, and Delhi.

Katy Perry and Justin Trudeau's dinner date in Montreal sparks romance rumoursKaty Perry and Justin Trudeau dined privately at a Montreal bistro, fueling romance rumours. With both recently single, their cozy meeting sparked speculation and social media buzz despite no official comment.

Live: Union Minister slams Rahul Gandhi for saying 'maza aa gaya' in Lok SabhaParliament Session 2025 Live Updates: As the Monsoon Session of Parliament enters its eighth day on Wednesday, the Rajya Sabha is expected to witness key interventions by senior ministers, with External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar expected to open the debate on Operation Sindoor at 1 pm, followed by Leader of the House JP Nadda around 3 pm. Union Home Minister Amit Shah is also likely to deliver the concluding speech in Parliament later in the day. The expected addresses come a day after high-voltage exchanges in both Houses, where Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Amit Shah led the government's offensive on the Operation Sindoor narrative. On the Opposition front, leaders including Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi, and Akhilesh Yadav attempted to mount a counterattack, questioning the government's handling of the India-Pakistan conflict. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in as we bring you the latest updates.

Why idea of free-fair polls in Bengal is ghorar dimAt a recent meeting, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee reminded block-level officers (BLOs) that they were state government employees. Bengal is the only state to have a Chief Electoral Officer's office under the Home and Hill Affairs Department. These and large-scale illegal immigration make the dream of free-fair polls in Mamata's Bengal nothing but bunkum.

Tsunami warning for Indian nationals from consulate in US: Move to higher areasAfter an 8.8-magnitude undersea quake off Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula, the Indian Consulate in San Francisco issued an advisory for Indians in California, other West Coast states, and Hawaii. Citizens are urged to follow local alerts, avoid coastal areas, move to higher ground if needed, and stay prepared. An emergency helpline number and e-mail were also shared.

Chhattisgarh government school teachers fail to spell 'eleven' in class. Watch videoThe Chhattisgarh government school staff, including two teachers and the headmaster, were seen fumbling with even the most elementary questions in a viral video.

Indian sponsor pulls out of WCL clash against PakistanIndian sponsor EaseMyTrip has pulled out of the India-Pakistan semi-final of the World Championship of Legends citing terror concerns. In a public statement, the company's founder has said that terror and cricket cannot go hand in hand.

100 lapses, including 7 critical, found at Air India base during audit: ReportAccording to the DGCA's findings, the airline was found to be non-compliant in areas such as crew training, duty and rest period regulations, inadequate crew strength, and airfield qualification.

Actor Prakash Raj appears before ED in Hyderabad in online betting apps caseActor Prakash Raj appeared before the ED in Hyderabad in connection with an alleged online betting app scam. The case involves 29 celebrities named in a Cyberabad police FIR. Investigations into financial trails continue.
I thought I was having a heart attack. The culprit was critical iron deficiencyThis is how a simple blood test revealed the real cause behind months of breathlessness, chest pain, and fatigue

Andhra school principal rapes Class 9 student, survivor 3 months pregnantA private school principal in Andhra Pradesh's Konaseema district raped a minor student. The assault surfaced after medical tests confirmed the Class 9 girl was three months pregnant.
TCS CEO's salary in focus amid mass layoff plan. Here's how much he earnsTCS recently confirmed it will let go of about 2% of its workforce in FY26, which translates to roughly 12,000 employees.

Who is Govindachami, the convict who made Kannur jailbreak?Serving life sentence in a 2011 rape-murder case, the one-handed convict had fled from the high-security block of the Central Prison in Kannur, only to be rearrested
Your kid might be a future mathematician if they do these 7 thingsIf your child loves patterns, puzzles, or even lining up their toys "just right," you might be raising a future maths genius.

Video: IAS officer does sit-ups on 1st day of posting over lack of cleanlinessOn his first day as Sub-Divisional Magistrate in Shahjahanpur, IAS officer Rinku Singh Rahi did sit-ups in front of protesting lawyers after making a clerk do the same for urinating in the open.

Rs 11 crore seized in Andhra liquor scam, sources link it to Jagan Reddy's partyThe SIT seized Rs 11 crore in cash from a farmhouse near Hyderabad while probing the Andhra Pradesh liquor scam. The seizure followed a confession by an accused in the case. Sources say that more high profile names related to the YSRCP could be added to the list of accused.

Inter-caste Bihar couple shares 'alvida' post, dies by suicide after elopingA young inter-caste couple from Bihar's Begusarai died by suicide eight months after eloping. The husband posted "Alvida" on Facebook before the tragic incident.

Farah Khan shares Salim Khan's early doubts about Salman's stardomFilmmaker Farah Khan shared that Salim Khan once doubted Salman Khan's Bollywood future, much like Saqib Saleem's father did. The filmmaker shared this during a chat with Huma Qureshi and Saqib about their struggles convincing their parents.

Find me in every lifetime: Sonam Kapoor's moving post on husband Anand's birthdaySonam Kapoor celebrated her husband Anand Ahuja's birthday with a heartfelt social media tribute, expressing deep affection and joy he brings to her life. Anil Kapoor also wished his son-in-law on the big day.

All about Sara Ali Khan's companion for Gurudwara visitSara Ali Khan's recent Gurudwara visit with Arjun Pratap Bajwa in Delhi has reignited dating rumours, leaving fans curious. Arjun, an actor-musician with a political lineage, is steadily gaining attention in Bollywood circles.

Sara Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor trolled for ramp walk at India Couture WeekActors Sara Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor faced the wrath of social media users for their ramp walk at India Couture Week. The videos of their ramp walk went viral on social media.

sports.headline: Jadeja at No.5? Sanjay Bangar on all-rounder's batting role in Indian teamSanjay Bangar feels that India can use Ravindra Jadeja as a pure batter in the side and use him in the No.5 role during the Oval Test. Jadeja has been one a golden run with the bat during the ongoing series against England.

India unlikely to risk Bumrah at Oval as medical staff advises rest: ReportIndia are unlikely to play Jasprit Bumrah in the fifth Test against England. The BCCI medical team wants to manage his workload and protect him as a longterm asset.

England have given serious advantage to India: Ashwin on Gambhir vs Oval curatorR Ashwin feels that the spat between Gautam Gambhir and Oval pitch curator Lee Fortis has given India a serious advantage heading into the final Test of the series. Gambhir and Fortis had a war of words on July 29.

Watch: Australia pacer bowls 18 balls in single over, including 12 widesWCL 2025: Australia lost to Pakistan by 10 wickets in their final match of WCL group-stage. Pacer John Hastings bowled an 18-ball over, where he gave away 12 wides.

Find it humiliating: Aakash Chopra slams Oval pitch curator for double standardsFormer cricketer Aakash Chopra criticised Oval pitch curator Lee Fortis over his double standards during a spat with Indian coach Gautam Gambhir. The Indian coach had a war of words with Fortis on Tuesday, July 29.

Shubman Gill eyes Sunil Gavaskar's 54-year-old India record: Stats PreviewENG vs IND: Shubman Gill is on the verge of several milestones in his career going into India's fifth and final Test against England, starting July 31 at the Old Trafford in Manchester.

Fraser McGurk snubbed from T20I squad as Australia announce squad vs SAAUS vs SA: Australia announced their white-ball squads against South Africa on Wednesday, July 30. Australia dropped young opener Jake Fraser-McGurk from both white-ball squads after consistently poor numbers. Mitch Owen was trusted after his sensational batting output against West Indies.

From taking a confrontational tone against journalists to a bust-up against the Oval groundstaff, how much is too much from Gambhir?

3 pacers, 3 spinners: Will India be tempted for some big bowling changes at the Oval?India must win the Oval Test to level the series against England. Bowling lineup decisions and Bumrah's fitness remain key concerns ahead of the match.

Sable suffers injury setback, World Championship hopes in doubtIndia's leading 3000m steeplechase athlete, Avinash Sable, has sustained a significant knee injury, potentially jeopardizing his participation in the World Athletics Championships set to take place in Tokyo this September.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
